org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.store

Class ServicePropertiesFileTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase
            • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.store.ServicePropertiesFileTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class ServicePropertiesFileTest
extends BaseJDBCTestCase
    Tests Derby's ability to recover from various conditions related to the service properties file.

    The basic pattern of the tests is to start with a pristine database, modify 'service.properties' and/or 'service.propertiesold', and then finally boot the database and assert what happened with the two aforementioned files.

      • testMissingServicePropertiesFileNoBackup

        public void testMissingServicePropertiesFileNoBackup()

      • testMissingServicePropertiesFileWithBackup

        public void testMissingServicePropertiesFileWithBackup()
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       java.sql.SQLException
        Tests handling of the situation where the service properties file is missing, but a backup is available.

        The expected behavior is to restore (by renaming) the service properties file from the backup.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • testSevicePropertiesFileWithBackup

        public void testSevicePropertiesFileWithBackup()
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               java.sql.SQLException
        Tests handling of the situation where both the service properties file and the backup are available.

        Expected behavior here is to delete the backup (given that the original service properties file contains the end-of-file token).

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • testSevicePropertiesFileCorruptedWithBackup

        public void testSevicePropertiesFileCorruptedWithBackup()
                                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                                        java.sql.SQLException
        Tests the situation where both the service properties file and a backup are available, but the service properties file is corrupted (see note below).

        The expected behavior is to delete the original service properties file and then restore it from the backup (i.e. by renaming).

        In this regard, a corrupt service properties file is one where the end-of-file token is missing. No other error conditions are detected, i.e. if properties are removed manually or the values are modified.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • testBackupWithBackupExisting

        public void testBackupWithBackupExisting()
                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                         java.sql.SQLException
        Ensures that Derby can handle the case where the backup file already exists when editing the service properties.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • connectThenShutdown

        private void connectThenShutdown(java.lang.String db)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Connects to the specified database, then shuts it down.

        This method is used to trigger the recovery logic for the service properties file.

        Parameters:
        db - database to connect to (expected to live in 'system/singleUse')
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
